content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Setup at (-15, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0)
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) for coal collection
Current status: Mining drill is out of fuel

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0)
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) containing 397 iron ore
Current status: Mining drill is out of fuel

### Iron Smelting Setup at (-10, 20)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (-11.0, 20.0) and (-9.0, 20.0)
Current status: Both furnaces have coal fuel but no ingredients to smelt

### Copper Processing Complex at (22, 20)
Consists of:
- Copper ore mining:
  - Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0)
  - Collection chest at (20.5, 21.5) containing 38 copper ore
- Intermediate storage:
  - Wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) containing 264 copper ore
- Smelting setup:
  - Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0)
  - Output chest at (24.5, 17.5) containing 52 copper plates
- Inserter network:
  - Burner inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving items from collection to storage
  - Burner inserter at (22.5, 20.5) feeding furnace
  - Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving finished plates
  - Support inserters at (20.5, 22.5) and (22.5, 22.5)
Current status: Mining drill is out of fuel, furnace has fuel but no ingredients

ERROR TIPS

### Belt Connection Errors
- Cannot connect belts directly from wooden chests
- Use inserters to move items from chests onto belts

### Fuel Management Issues
- Ensure coal is available in inventory before attempting to insert fuel into machines
- Keep mining drills fueled to maintain continuous operation
- Set up automated fuel delivery systems for mining drills and inserters

### Resource Flow Issues
- Multiple machines are idle due to lack of resources or fuel
- Implement proper resource distribution systems to keep all machines operational
- Consider setting up automated coal distribution to prevent machines running out of fuel
